Super fudgy brownies.By Alex DelanyJanuary 11, 2018FacebookTwitterEmailPhoto by Bobbi LinFacebookTwitterEmailOn the Super Bowl menu this year: Beef Chili, Skillet Cornbread, Hot Honey Butter, and Fudgy Brownies.There are a few things I'll leave my seat for when the Super Bowl is on—this is an evening when couch space is guarded with one's life. But a bowl of chili is one of them. Not just any chili, though. I'm talking about a monumental pot of deeply flavorful, perfectly spiced beef chili. In Claire Saffitz's new recipe (below), using intact dried chiles instead of jarred powders contributes a more complex flavor and saturated color. And you're drinking already, so why not pour some beer into the pot? Lager imparts just the right amount of bitterness, rounding out the chilis. Then pile on as many chili toppings as you can handle: everything from Fritos to chopped red onion to sour cream to avocado.While you're up, grab a piece of skillet cornbread with a healthy serving of hot honey butter, and snag another beer before the commercial break's over. The game might be on TV, but as real Super Bowl party champions can attest, athletics matter in the trip to and from the kitchen, too. Make a victory lap for those extra fudgy brownies.You can pull this Super Bowl menu off no problem if you think ahead. Make the chili up to four days before. Let it cool, and then refrigerate. The morning of the game, assemble and bake the cornbread, and mix the hot honey butter (it's only three ingredients!). An hour before kickoff, it's time to reheat the chili and prep all the fixings. Put them all in bowls for your chili assembly line.
